page.title: 07FARMING AROUND DURSLEY
page.content: Surrounding the town of Dursley are large areas of fields and woods. The land is used mainly for cattle farming, with some arable farming. Beef cattle are bought and sold at Gloucester market about 12 miles away and milk from the dairy farms is taken to the Milk Marketing Board depot at Stonehouse about 10 miles away. One local farmer on the outskirts of Dursley farms on fields which have been in his family since the beginning of the century. Roads and paths on the farm were laid out at that time with waste material taken from the blast furnaces ofa nearby factory. His work is mainly beef cattle rearing. It is a family concern with casual help being employed only occassionally.
